weather_report:
In the early hours of Christmas Eve, Downtown San Francisco greets the day shrouded in a blanket of clouds, with intermittent rain that adds a rhythmic patter to the city’s heartbeat. The air, crisp and cool at around fifty-three degrees, carries with it an invigorating energy, fueled by gusty west winds. As the sun begins its ascent, expect rain showers to linger until the early afternoon, finally giving way to a tentative foray into partial sunshine. The prospect of a high reaching fifty-eight, only to soften as temperatures dip again, suggests moments of reflective beauty, a city caught in transition, where the shadows of clouds dance across the ground while raindrops linger on surfaces.

For those venturing out today, layering is wise—think a warm, water-resistant jacket over a cozy sweater. An umbrella or a stylish raincoat will serve well against the sporadic showers, especially since the chance of precipitation remains high and conditions may turn brisk with gusts up to twenty-four miles per hour. As the holiday spirit weaves through the streets, perhaps a leisurely café visit with a steaming cup of coffee or tea would be perfect, offering a cozy respite against the chill. Alternatively, take a stroll through the misty embrace of the waterfront, where the faint presence of a marine layer hints at the ocean’s proximity, evoking a sense of wonder in the gray-skied scenery—an ideal way to embrace the beauty of San Francisco on this eventful day.
